firstcoursecausaldata 0.1.0

Academic Performance Incentives Experiment Dataset

Source: R/data.R
angrist2009.Rd

A dataset from Angrist et al. (2009) containing data from a randomized experiment conducted at a Canadian university to evaluate different strategies to improve academic performance among college freshmen. The data focuses on the control group and the treatment group offered academic support services and financial incentives for good grades.

Usage

angrist2009

Format

A data frame with 1,656 observations and 48 variables:

GPA_year1, GPA_year2

Double. 1st and 2nd year GPA

age

Double. Age

gpa0

Double. High school GPA

control

Logical. Control group indicator (TRUE = control, FALSE = treatment)

female

Logical. Female dummy

english

Logical. Mother tongue is English

credits_earned1, credits_earned2

Double. Credits earned in years 1 and 2

totcredits_year1

Double. Total credits attempted

finish4

Logical. Intends to finish in 4 years

goodstanding_year1, goodstanding_year2

Logical. Good standing in years 1 and 2

prob_year1, prob_year2

Logical. On probation in years 1 and 2

mom_edn, dad_edn

Double. Mother and father education

mom1, mom2, dad1, dad2

Logical. Mother/father HS and college graduate indicators

mtongue, sex

Character. Mother tongue and sex

hsgroup

Double. High school group

chooseUTM

Logical. At 1st choice school

hcom

Logical. Lives at home

mathsci

Double. Number of math and science credits attempted

work1

Logical. Plans to work while in school

numcourses_nov1

Double. Courses enrolled as of fall 2005

grade_20059_fall

Double. Fall grade

lastmin

Double. How often leaves studying until last minute

lm_never, lm_rarely

Logical. Never/rarely puts off studying for tests

sfp, sfp_p, sfsp, sfsp_p

Logical. Offered/signed-up for student support programs

sfpany, sfpany_p

Logical. Offered/signed-up for any support program

ssp, ssp_p

Logical. Offered/signed-up for student services program

used_ssp, used_fsg, used_adv

Logical. Received SSP services, attended FSGs, met advisor

compsurv, noshow, signup

Logical. Completed survey, no show, signed up for STAR

graddeg

Logical. Wants more than a BA

Source

Angrist, J., Lavy, V., Schlosser, A. (2009). The effects of high stakes high school achievement awards: Evidence from a randomized trial. American Economic Review, 99(4), 1384-1414.

Data obtained from Harvard Dataverse: https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataset.xhtml?persistentId=doi:10.7910/DVN/ZX3VEV

Details

The experiment randomly assigned college freshmen to different treatment conditions including academic support services (SFP, SSP, SFSP) and financial incentives for good grades. The primary outcomes are academic performance measures such as GPA in the first and second years, completion rates, and academic standing.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
data(angrist2009)
summary(angrist2009)
table(angrist2009$control)
mean(angrist2009$GPA_year1[!angrist2009$control])  # Treatment group GPA
mean(angrist2009$GPA_year1[angrist2009$control])   # Control group GPA
} # }
